alert.note: Alert for Southern Columbia; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:01PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Bradford, Baker, Union, northeastern Columbia and south central Charlton Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Butler, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Butler, Raiford, Taylor, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Palestine Community, Olustee, Beasley, New River and Lulu. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
